extendedIngredients.name: chili

recipes.title: Chicken Fajita Alfredo

winePairing.pairingText: Riesling, Sparkling rosé, and Pinot Noir are my top picks for Fajitas. Acidic white wines like riesling or low-tannin reds like pinot noir can work well with Mexican dishes. Sparkling rosé is a safe pairing too. You could try Poet's Leap Riesling. Reviewers quite like it with a 4 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 20 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Poet's Leap Riesling
productMatches.description: Key lime and fresh citrus peel aromas give way to vivid layers of white peach and stone fruit flavors accented by a pleasant touch of minerality. Delicious natural acidity and a hint of residual sugar provide a balanced, vibrant mouth-feel and lengthy finish.

recipes.instructions: Directions                                                                                Cook pasta according to package directions.                                                                                           Meanwhile, in a Dutch oven, saute mushrooms and squash in oil until tender. Add garlic; saute 1 minute longer. Stir in the fajitas, tomatoes, Alfredo sauce and oregano. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; simmer, uncovered, for 5-10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Drain pasta; add to fajita mixture and toss to coat.                                        Yield: 5 servings.                                                                                                                         Originally published as Chicken Fajita Alfredo in  Simple & DeliciousJune/July 2012, p18                                                                                                                                                                                                        Nutritional Facts                                                                             1-1/2 cups equals 377 calories, 10 g fat (4 g saturated fat), 11 mg cholesterol, 1,217 mg sodium, 55 g carbohydrate, 6 g fiber, 21 g protein.                                                                                                                                                                    Print                                                                                    Add to Recipe Box                            Email a Friend

steps.step: Cook pasta according to package directions.
Meanwhile, in a Dutch oven, saute mushrooms and squash in oil until tender.
Add garlic; saute 1 minute longer. Stir in the fajitas, tomatoes, Alfredo sauce and oregano. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; simmer, uncovered, for 5-10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Drain pasta; add to fajita mixture and toss to coat.
